name: Michael Sheng
content: Prof. Quan Z. (Michael) Sheng's Home Page Distinguished Professor Michael Sheng School of Computing Faculty of Science and Engineering   Macquarie University Sydney, NSW 2109, Australia Office: Room 233, 4 Research Park Drive Email: michael[DOT]sheng[AT]mq[DOT]edu[DOT]au All things are difficult before they are easy, just do it! Please check out our exciting 2024 achievements. Dr. Michael Sheng is a Distinguished Professor and Head of School of Computing at Macquarie University. Before moving to Macquarie, Michael spent 10 years at School of Computer Science, the University of Adelaide (UoA), serving in a number of senior leadership roles including interim Head and Deputy Head of School of Computer Science. Michael holds a PhD degree in computer science from the University of New South Wales (UNSW) and did his post-doc as a research scientist at CSIRO ICT Centre. From 1999 to 2001, Michael worked at UNSW as a visiting research fellow. Prior to that, he spent 6 years as a senior software engineer in industries. Dr. Michael Sheng is ranked by Microsoft Academic as one of the Most Impactful Authors in Services Computing (ranked Top 5 All Time) and in Web of Things (ranked Top 20 All Time) in 2021. He is ranked as one of the Highly Ranked Scholars (Top 5 both Lifetime and Prior 5 Years) in Web Information System by ScholarGPS. He is the recipient of the 2018 AMiner Most Influential Scholar Award on IoT (2007-2017), ARC Future Fellowship (2014), Chris Wallace Award for Outstanding Research Contribution (2012), and Microsoft Research Fellowship (2003). Prof Michael Sheng is a member of the Advisory Committee of the IEEE Technical Community on Services Computing (IEEE TCSVC) and a member of the ACS Technical Advisory Board on IoT. He is a Deputy Director of the ARC Research Hub in the IoT for Water. Dr. Michael Sheng's research team, funding, publications, research profile and professional activities. Media 1 Distinguished Professors (This Week Macquarie University), Media 2 10 Questions with Michael Sheng (This Week Macquarie University), Media 3 on improvement of trustworthiness of online information (The Lighthouse), Media 4 on trust management research (ACM TechNews), Media 5 on smart cities (MQ News, Video). Media 5 on aging population research (The Australian). Main external profiles: Research Interests Internet of Things, Big Data Analytics, Machine Learning, Intelligent Computing, Web Science, Service Computing.
